    Reference

    All functions

    bitR_orange_paged() bitR_blue_paged()

    Create a paged HTML document suitable for printing with bitR Brand

    bitReport

    bitReport package

    bit_all_pal

    Look-up list of palettes

    bit_all_pal_graphic

    Look-up list of palettes

    bit_black

    bitR color black

    bit_blue

    bitR color blue

    bit_darkblue

    Preferred color darkblue (as HEX character value)

    bit_discrete()

    Ggplot scale color discrete and continuous palette based on the bit_pal_graphic

    bit_green

    Preferred color darkblue (as HEX character value)

    bit_grey

    bitR color grey

    bit_orange

    bitR color orange

    bit_pal

    bit default (web/sRGB) Primary color palette

    bit_pal_blue

    bitR blue color palette

    bit_pal_darkblue

    bitR darkblue color palette.

    bit_pal_graphic

    Scale of all XX preferred colors for graphic creation

    bit_pal_green

    bitR greem color palette.

    bit_pal_grey

    bitR grey color palette

    bit_pal_orange

    bitR orange color palette

    bit_pal_primary

    Scale of all 4 preferred colors, Other combinations of bitR color palettes

    bit_pal_red

    bitR red color palette.

    bit_pal_yellow

    bitR yellow color palette.

    bit_red

    Preferred color red (as HEX character value)

    bit_scale_colour_discrete()

    Discrete color scales based on the bitR graphic palette

    bit_scale_fill_discrete()

    Discrete fill scales based on the bitR graphic palette

    bit_theme()

    Basic bitR theme for ggplot2

    bit_white

    bitR color white

    bit_yellow

    Preferred color yellow (as HEX character value)

    col2hex()

    col2hex color conversion function in grDevices

    compare_country_metric()

    국가 통계의 전년도와의 성장률 비교

    Create a Distill website

    economies

    newpal()

    Define new color palettes.

    plot_country_trend()

    seecol()

    Plot the colors of a palette or multiple palettes

    theme_foundation()

    Base clean ggplot theme to build from

    update_geom_font_defaults()

    Update matching font defaults for text geoms

    usecol()

    Use a color palette (as is)
